alert.note: Alert for Union (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 13 at 7:17PM CST until December 13 at 9:00PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Arkansas and Louisiana, including the following counties and parishes, in Arkansas, Columbia and Union. In Louisiana, Claiborne and Union. * WHEN...Until 1015 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 716 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... El Dorado, Homer, Norphlet, Junction City, Haynesville, Calion, Wesson, Lisbon, Atlanta, Lawson, Urbana, Three Creeks, Hew Hope, Newell, Cairo, Catesville, Kenova and Pigeon Hill.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
